so ee it was, I consider it as a worst move than my proposed d5 as it puts another pawn in a dark square, leaving me with the chance of playing e6 with all my pawns on light squares and a good bishop against white's weaker bishop, plus my pawn majority on the queen side might be an advantage in the endgame, for now white has more space and a better centre...
